name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

key_work.title: The first home console
key_work.brief_description: In 1966, the father of videogames, Ralph Baer, began developing the Brown Box prototype, the forerunner to the first home console ever released, the Magnavox Odyssey.

constellations_primary.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_primary.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

start.title: The Art of Ping Pong
start.brief_description: The Art of Ping Pong, by Bristol based artist Jono Sandilands, utilises projection mapping of a ping pong table to record player interactions and create multimedia art installations.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

end.title: Top Spin
end.creator_credit: Sara Newens and Mina T. Son
end.brief_description: Three teenagers battle their way through the world of competitive ping pong with their hearts set on the Olympics.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

links.description: Part of the brief behind the creation of The Art of Ping Pong was to encourage young people to take up the sport.

start.title: Tennis
start.brief_description: Tennis was one of the original Magnavox Odyssey games.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

end.title: Pong
end.brief_description: Pong is a tennis game with simple two-dimensional graphics. It is one of the earliest arcade video games and the first sports arcade video game.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

links.description: Released the same year as the Odyssey, Pong was a game that took arcades by storm and helped launch Atari’s success in the industry.

start.title: Ping Pong
start.brief_description: Ping Pong is a 2002 sports film directed by Japanese filmmaker Fumihiko Sori. It is based on Taiy≈ç Matsumoto’s manga of the same name and is about the friendship between two high school table tennis players.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

end.title: Top Spin
end.creator_credit: Sara Newens and Mina T. Son
end.brief_description: Three teenagers battle their way through the world of competitive ping pong with their hearts set on the Olympics.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

links.description: Top Spin echoes the drama of Ping Pong as it follows the real-life trials and tribulations of three high school students as they compete to earn a place on the 2012 US Olympic table tennis team.

start.title: The first home console
start.brief_description: In 1966, the father of videogames, Ralph Baer, began developing the Brown Box prototype, the forerunner to the first home console ever released, the Magnavox Odyssey.

constellations_primary.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_primary.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

end.title: Tennis
end.brief_description: Tennis was one of the original Magnavox Odyssey games.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

links.description: The Magnavox Odyssey was the first home game console, featuring Tennis as one of its playable games ‚Äì the game was created by three square dots on a CRT screen.

start.title: Pong
start.brief_description: Pong is a tennis game with simple two-dimensional graphics. It is one of the earliest arcade video games and the first sports arcade video game.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

end.title: Ping Pong
end.brief_description: Ping Pong is a 2002 sports film directed by Japanese filmmaker Fumihiko Sori. It is based on Taiy≈ç Matsumoto’s manga of the same name and is about the friendship between two high school table tennis players.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

links.description: Adapted from a manga, Ping Pong uses the sport as a mechanism to explore a story of friendship between two high school students.

start.title: Pong
start.brief_description: Pong is a tennis game with simple two-dimensional graphics. It is one of the earliest arcade video games and the first sports arcade video game.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

end.title: Pong
end.brief_description: Pong, the 2007 single from German cyber-goth band Eisenfunk, extensively uses samples from the game Pong, as well as featuring a stylised version of it in the video clip.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

links.description: ‘Pong’, by German cyber-goth band Eisenfunk, uses samples from the game Pong while presenting a hyper-stylised version of the game in its video clip.

start.title: Ping Pong
start.brief_description: Ping Pong is a 2002 sports film directed by Japanese filmmaker Fumihiko Sori. It is based on Taiy≈ç Matsumoto’s manga of the same name and is about the friendship between two high school table tennis players.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

end.title: The Art of Ping Pong
end.brief_description: The Art of Ping Pong, by Bristol based artist Jono Sandilands, utilises projection mapping of a ping pong table to record player interactions and create multimedia art installations.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

links.description: The installation artwork The Art of Ping Pong records and utilises player data from games of ping pong to create evolving multimedia artworks.
